The former American Idol judge was asked during a news conference whether viewers would see the "old Simon Cowell " or a different side to him when the show premieres on Fox later this year. Look, you adapt over the years, he replied. "I started to cringe when I started to see people being booked as the so-called mean judge and just being gratuitously rude for the sake of it. The competition series will allow contestants as young as 12 to audition, a decision Simon Cowell defended on the call after being asked if kids that young should be subjects to public scrutiny. We've started to see a trend with kids this age and what they can do. I like the idea that a 12-year-old on this show can compete with an older singer... times have changed. You have to make a case-by-case decision based on them as a person. Contestants will have to audition before a live audience of 5,000 people in an arena.
